field.comment: An actual internal identifier of the server group that reported the event. It is managed by the capturing party to differentiate between servers. Access is granted at the group level.
field.name: serverGroupId

field.comment: An optional internal identifier for the server
field.name: serverId

field.comment: The host name of the server
field.name: serverHost

field.comment: The artifact that triggered the event (if any)
field.name: artifactId

field.comment: A local id of the event
field.name: localId

field.comment: The event name, as decided by the originator
field.name: eventName

field.comment: The event category as decided by the originator
field.name: eventCategory

field.comment: An anonymous single identifier of the user
field.name: authenticationId

field.comment: The message should not contain variables, it is a description of the error type
field.name: message

field.comment: The context in which this occurred (e.g. service stack)
field.name: context

field.comment: An external id for this event
field.name: externalId

field.comment: A further clarification of the message, it can contain as many variables as are relevant to understand the problem
field.name: reason

field.comment: Any structured data
field.name: data

field.comment: Correlate an event to other events
field.name: correlationId

field.comment: The session id (especially for web contexts)
field.name: sessionId

field.comment: Each event can have a unique id, this can be communicated to other parties
field.name: eventId

field.comment: Whether or not this event has been anonimized
field.name: anonymized

field.comment: When the event was last checked for classification based on rules
field.name: classified

field.comment: When the event was last notified
field.name: notified

field.comment: The classification that was assigned to this event by retroactive rule evaluation or manual action
field.name: classification

field.comment: The id of the rule that triggered this classification
field.name: eventRuleId

field.comment: This contains any additional information in the event that was not captured in one of the above fields, marshalled as JSON
field.name: additional

field.comment: Correlate multiple events within for example a single REST call.
field.name: contextId

field.comment: The origin of the event (e.g. frontend, backend, service runtime vs security...)
field.name: origin

field.comment: A component within the origin, this is a larger part of the stack.
field.name: component

field.comment: Can indicate whether a cache was used
field.name: cached

field.comment: The threshold for this event
field.name: threshold

field.comment: The event state, one of "CREATED", "CLASSIFIED", "NOTIFIED", "IGNORED"
field.name: state

field.comment: The priority of the event can be manipulated with rules and can be used in signalling. You choose (based on the rules) how many levels you have.
field.name: priority

field.comment: If an event has been looked at and "handled", the priority is likely changed and a comment can be added to indicate the reasoning.
field.name: comment

field.comment: The alias of the impersonator (if any)
field.name: impersonator

field.comment: The realm of the impersonator
field.name: impersonatorRealm

field.comment: The unique identifier of the impersonator
field.name: impersonatorId

field.comment: You can group events together
field.name: groupKey

field.comment: Correlate events in a larger narrative, usually cross system
field.name: conversationId
